Beinn Sgritheall

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Beinn Sgritheall has one of the finest situations of any of the Munros, towering above the tiny village of Arnisdale on Loch Huorn. Its ascent is unrelentingly steep but the views from the summit are amongst the finest in Scotland.

 You have not climbed Beinn Sgritheall.

Region: Kintail

Altitude: 974 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 4.10/5
Rating: 4.1/5 (70 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Beinn Sgritheall from Arnisdale

Other routes and challenges

Less steep approaches are possible, but these are much longer. One option is to head up into Coire Min before heading for the bealach between the summit and point 906m. Another, finer one is to tackle the NE ridge, which provides a dramatic walk with no scrambling involved.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Kintail Hotels

Kintail B&B

Kintail Cottages

Kintail Hostels
